item.title: Nvidia DLSS 4 Will Be Available for 75 Games At Launch
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/nvidia-dlss-4-games/

Nvidia DLSS 4 capabilities, such as Multi Frame Generation, will be available for 75 games at launch. Check out the full list below.

Nvidia unveiled its latest version of deep learning super sampling software at CES 2025, where the audience first saw the capabilities of DLSS 4. The latest version introduces a new feature, DLSS Multi Frame Generation, and enhances all existing features, such as Frame Generation, Ray Reconstruction, Super-resolution, and Deep Learning Anti-Aliasing. 

To make an impact on launch day, Nvidia DLSS 4 will be introduced for some of the most popular games out there, including God of War Ragnarok, Indiana Jones and the Great Circle, Marvel Rivals, and more. Moreover, the DLSS 4 will also be available for highly anticipated upcoming titles like Black State, Doom: The Dark Ages, The Witcher 4, and Dune Awakening. 

Nvidia DLSS 4 Games

Spotted by IGN, the complete list of the 75 Nvidia DLSS 4 games can be found below: 

  • A Quiet Place: The Road Ahead
  • Akimbot
  • Alan Wake 2
  • Aunt Fatima
  • Backrooms: Escape Together
  • Bears in Space
  • Bellwright
  • Crown Simulator
  • Cyberpunk 2077
  • D5 Render
  • DESORDRE: A Puzzle Adventure
  • Dynasty Warriors: Origins
  • Deceit 2
  • Deep Rock Galactic
  • Deliver Us to Mars
  • Desynced: Autonomous Colony Simulator
  • Diablo IV
  • Direct Contact
  • Dragon Age: The Veilguard
  • Dugeonborne
  • Dynasty Warriors: Origins
  • Enlisted
  • Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
  • Fort Solis
  • Frostpunk 2
  • Ghostrunner 2
  • God of War Ragnarök
  • Gray Zone Warfare
  • Ground Branch
  • Hitman World of Assassination
  • Hogwarts Legacy
  • ICARUS
  • Immortals of Aveum
  • Indiana Jones and the Great Circle
  • Jusant
  • JX Online 3
  • Kristala
  • Layers of Fear
  • Liminalcore
  • Lords of the Fallen
  • Marvel Rivals
  • Microsoft Flight Simulator
  • Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024
  • Mortal Online 2
  • Naraka Bladepoint
  • Need for Speed Unbound
  • Once Human
  • Outpost: Infinity Seige
  • Pax Dei
  • Payday 3
  • QANGA
  • Ready or Not
  • Remnant II
  • Satisfactory
  • SCUM
  • Senua’s Saga: Hellblade II
  • Silent Hill 2
  • Skye: The Misty Isle
  • Slender: The Arrival
  • Squad
  • S.T.A.L.K.E.R 2: Heart of Chernobyl
  • Star Wars Outlaws
  • Star Wars Jedi: Survivor
  • Starship Troopers: Extermination
  • Still Wakes the Deep
  • Supermoves
  • Test Drive Unlimited Solar Crown
  • The Axis Unseen
  • The Black Pool
  • THE FINALS
  • The First Descendent
  • The Thaumaturge
  • Torque Drift 2
  • Tribes 3: Rivals
  • Witchfire
  • World of Jade Dynasty

In other news, PUBG is set to feature Nvidia AI ‘Ally’ Companions. Also, check out the official reveal for RTX 50 series graphics cards. What are your thoughts on the games receiving Nvidia DLSS 4 at launch? Let us know in the comments below or our community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the leaked X-men characters for Marvel Rivals. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Store Listing Says New 3D Mario, Legend of Zelda Remake Coming In 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/store-listing-says-new-3d-mario-legend-of-zelda-remake-coming-in-2025/

A new 3D Mario and A Legend of Zelda remake are coming to Nintendo Switch 2 in 2025. At least, that’s according to one store listing online.

On the popular e-tailer Newegg, the product description for a $50 Nintendo eShop Gift Card mentions a number of games coming in 2025. According to that description, which you can see below, 2025 will feature “Metroid Prime 4: Beyond, New 3D Mario, New Mario Kart, A Legend of Zelda Remake/Remaster, Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition, Pokemon Legends: Z-A”.

A new Mario Kart was already confirmed with the reveal trailer for the Nintendo Switch 2. A new 3D Mario and A Legend of Zelda Remake have been rumored and expected, but there’s been nothing in the form of a confirmation from Nintendo. While this can’t be viewed as a confirmation, either, it’s still something from a major storefront.

Insider Gaming has reached out to both Newegg and Nintendo regarding the store posting and its accuracy. Should a response be received, this story will be updated accordingly as well as posted on Insider Gaming’s social media channels.

The Nintendo Switch 2 was officially revealed on January 16. A full Nintendo Direct on the new system is set to air on April 2, which is expected to reveal full specs, pricing, release date, and more. There are also rumors of major AAA games coming to the system, though it’s unknown if any will be announced during the Nintendo Direct.

What do you think of a new 3D Mario and Legend of Zelda remake coming in 2025? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, read about the latest sales milestone for Insider Gaming’s Indie Game of the Year, Balatro. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.

item.title: Black Ops 6 Season 2 Trailer Gives More Details On Maps, Modes, and More
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/black-ops-6-season-2-trailer-gives-more-details-on-maps-modes-and-more/

Activision has released a new trailer for Call of Duty: Black Ops 6, confirming five new multiplayer maps and a returning mode during Season 2.

Starting January 28 when the new season launches, players will get access to three new maps with two additional ones coming mid-season. The three maps coming at the beginning of the season are Bounty, Dealership, and Lifeline while Bullet and Grind come midseason. As far as the location details, there’s not much to go on with the maps aside from what was shown in the short trailer.

Lifeline is a small map that’s set on a burning ship in the middle of the sea; dealership takes place in an area surrounding a car dealership of some sort; and bounty, while hard to fully decipher, appears to be at a mansion or museum. Again, however, that was the toughest to see the exact location.

In addition to the new maps, Black Ops 6 Season 2 sees the return of Gun Game along with new weapons such as swords. Lastly, the trailer gives a glimpse at the new Zombies map, The Tomb. According to Treyarch, The Tomb was designed with “tighter play spaces with a focus on replayability”.

Full details on everything coming in Season 2 is expected this week. One detail that’s been confirmed is that players will be able to turn off cross-play in Ranked Mode moving forward.

What do you think of the new details shown in the Black Ops 6 Season 2 trailer? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, read about the latest tease from Mortal Kombat creator Ed Boon about the future of Mortal Kombat 1. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.

item.title: Xbox Increases External Storage Size Support
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/xbox-increases-external-storage-size-support/

Xbox is increasing the size of external storage the Xbox Series consoles will support. In a new update coming to the consoles—Xbox Insiders will get first access to the feature—external hard drives larger than 16TB will now be compatible with the systems.

“We are enabling support for external USB drives larger than 16TB, so you can be sure your favorite games are always ready to play,” the company said. “Newly formatted drives that are larger than 16TB will be formatted with multiple partitions to utilize all available space for games and apps. These will appear as multiple devices in the storage devices list.”

While the company says that the update adds support for “drives larger than 16TB”, it doesn’t set a new limit. Based on that, it could be inferred that the partition method allows as large of a external drive as you can afford. If you already have a larger drive, Microsoft says they may need to be reformatted.

“Drives greater than 16TB that have already been formatted will be unaffected by this change and would need to be reformatted to take advantage of the updated support for larger drives,” they said.

This isn’t going to be the only news from Xbox this week as the company airs their annual Developer Direct on January 23. Insider Gaming will have full coverage of all the news that comes from the showcase.

What do you think of Xbox increasing its support for external storage beyond 16TB? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, read about the latest tease from Mortal Kombat creator Ed Boon about the future of Mortal Kombat 1. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.
